byline.contributor: Falih Hassan and Omar Al-Jawoshy reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Beirut, Lebanon. An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Najaf, Iraq.
byline.original: By FALIH HASSAN, TIM ARANGO and OMAR AL-JAWOSHY

abstract: Minivan packed with explosives detonates in central Baghdad, Iraq, killing at least 143 people; attack, deadliest in years, marks country's third mass slaughter in under one week; Islamic State claims responsibility.
lead_paragraph: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack in a middle-class neighborhood, the deadliest assault in years in the Iraqi capital.

headline.main: Bombing Kills More Than 140 in Baghdad
headline.print_headline: 3rd Mass Attack in Days Leaves 143 Dead in Iraq

snippet: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack in a middle-class neighborhood, the deadliest assault in years in the Iraqi capital....
